info.senderName: NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 29 at 6:53AM MDT until July 29 at 9:00AM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring.
* WHERE...South-central Luna County in Southern New Mexico.
* WHEN...Until 900 AM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Deep standing water and flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 653 AM MDT, Heavy rainfall of over 3 inches occurred just east and south of Columbus village during the predawn hours. While rainfall has diminished, areas of flooding remain due to the slowly draining terrain in the area. At 740 AM, county dispatchers reported water 2 feet deep just north of the Columbus Palomas Port of Entry. Water was also flowing across Highway 11 between mile markers 1 and 2. Deep water was also reported near mile marker 93 on Highway 9 just east of Columbus. - Rainfall amounts over the village of Columbus were much lower, though over 1.20 inches was recorded at Pancho Villa State Park. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Columbus. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MDT THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING
